{{champion:238}} >{{champion:64}} >{{champion:84}} >{{champion:85}} >{{champion:98}}

But if it's team fighting, or skirmishes, it's more like:

{{champion:238}} >{{champion:98}} >{{champion:85}} >{{champion:84}} >{{champion:64}} 

Now I am not defending any of these champions in any way, it's just shen can land multiple people with a taunt for near full energy, and kennen gets a lot of AOE stuns. Akali has cooldowns to manage and spams a lot, and lee sins really don't care about auto attacking too much in a teamfight, they just need to qq ww ee r

Ever since the change last year to his hitbox, his taunt has a very slim chance of really catching more than 2 people unless they are graphically on top of each other. You normally will not hit more than 2.

Also Kennen's stuns are not guaranteed, unless you hit everyone with your W and R, and still his ultimate randomly strikes champions in the AoE. It's not reliable outside of 1 - 2 people. I honestly think that Kennen is in the worst place. He can't compete against other mages and he's a very mediocre ranged top champion. Good against Riven though which is a nice bonus.

Akali's cooldowns are mostly negligible, minus her shroud, because her ultimate is costless and her passive provides a lot of sustain and damage to make up for waiting.

Zed's energy management is actually quite poor, especially early game.
When he tries to WEQ combo in lane, it will leave him with only enough energy to E again once it comes off cool down.

Among the energy users, his capacity to regenerate his energy is mediocre, since he can only refund the cost of his abilities if he and his shadow both hits the same enemy.

However, Zed does give off the illusion of never running out of energy because of the nature of this resource. It regenerates 5 to 10 times faster than mana, he may exhaust himself in one combo, but he can get it back in 6 to 8 seconds.

To a traditional mana mage, this make it seem as if Zed is constantly able to use abilities. But if you play another energy champion, a mage with mana regen abilities or passive, or a manaless champion, you will see how terrible Zed's energy costs actually are.

Early on, Zed cannot depend on his shadow for energy and his skills cost the most with only one point into them. I find it rather easy to kill Zed at these levels once he blows his shadow; without his W, his ratios are only average early game, and he can't fight back.
